article: Jeff Keith has only one leg. When he was only twelve years old, Jeff had cancer. Doctors had to  _  off most of his right leg.  Every day  Jeff puts on an artificial leg . The leg is plastic. With the plastic leg, Jeff can ski, ride a bicycle, swim, and play soccer. He can also run. Jeff made a plan with his friends who had plastic legs  _  . They decided to  _  across America. They all wore special T-shirts.  _  it was "Run, Jeff, Run, Jeff Keith's Run Across America". Jeff Keith ran across the United States from the east to the west  _  he was twenty-two years old. He started running in Boston . Seven  _  later, he stopped  running  in Los Angeles . He ran 3,200 miles (1 mile =" 1.6093km)." Jeff wore out thirty-six pairs  _  running shoes and five plastic legs. Jeff  _  in cities on the way to Los Angeles. In every city people gave Jeff money. The money was not for Jeff,  _  for the American Cancer Society. The Society used the money to help people know  _  about cancer. On the way to Los Angeles, Jeff talked to people about  _  . Jeff is disabled, but he can do many things. He finished college and is studying to be a lawyer . Jeff says, "People can do  _  they want to do. I want people to know that. I ran  not only  for disabled people. I ran for everybody."
